meanings.definition: The baseboard or molding along the bottom of a wall.
meanings.sent1: I painted the skirtings in the living room white to match the walls.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter installed new skirtings in the hallway to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to hide behind the skirtings and surprise us.
meanings.sent4: The skirtings hugged the walls like a protective barrier.
meanings.sent5: I accidentally bumped into the skirtings and left a small dent.

meanings.definition: The act of skirting around or avoiding something.
meanings.sent1: Her skirtings of the topic during the meeting were quite obvious.
meanings.sent2: The politician's skirtings of the controversial issue did not go unnoticed.
meanings.sent3: His constant skirtings of responsibility eventually caught up with him.
meanings.sent4: She mastered the art of skirtings to avoid uncomfortable situations.
meanings.sent5: The detective's skirtings around the truth kept everyone guessing.

meanings.definition: The edges or borders of something.
meanings.sent1: The skirtings of the forest were filled with hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully outlined the skirtings of the painting to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The skirtings of the puzzle were the most challenging part to complete.
meanings.sent4: The skirtings of the garden were lined with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The skirtings of the cliff dropped dramatically into the ocean below.
